artifacts.content:
{
  "mvp_features": [
    "Landing page with prompt window",
    "Builder page with file explorer, editor, and AI chat",
    "Token system with 5 free tokens",
    "Build progress display",
    "Login and Signup pages",
    "Button, Input, and Textarea components"
  ],
  "roadmap": [
    {
      "phase": "MVP",
      "features": [
        "Landing page with prompt window",
        "Builder page with file explorer, editor, and AI chat",
        "Token system with 5 free tokens",
        "Build progress display",
        "Login and Signup pages"
      ],
      "timeline": "Weeks 1-4"
    },
    {
      "phase": "Post-MVP",
      "features": [
        "AI-powered build functionality",
        "Project saving and loading",
        "Deploy to production",
        "Additional features based on user feedback"
      ],
      "timeline": "Weeks 5-12"
    }
  ],
  "technical_requirements": [
    "Next.js 14 App Router",
    "React 18",
    "TypeScript strict mode",
    "Tailwind CSS",
    "No external UI libraries",
    "Client components where needed ('use client')",
    "localStorage for token/prompt storage"
  ],
  "success_criteria": [
    "Landing page loads with prompt window as main focus",
    "Login/Signup buttons are on RIGHT side of header",
    "Start Building stores prompt and redirects to /builder",
    "Builder shows 5 tokens initially",
    "Builder layout: file explorer | editor+preview | AI chat",
    "Build progress shows in editor area",
    "Messages use tokens (decrement counter)",
    "Token = 0 triggers signup prompt",
    "Login/Signup pages work with proper redirects",
    "All links point to real routes that exist"
  ]
}

decisions.choice: {"pattern":"monolith","reasoning":"Given the project's initial scope and requirements, a monolithic
decisions.reasoning: Given the project's initial scope and requirements, a monolithic architecture is suitable for the OLYMPUS frontend. This approach allows for a more straightforward development process and easier maintenance. As the project grows, the architecture can be reassessed and potentially transitioned to a microservices pattern if needed.
